SENT.plain: The clinical and hematological characteristics of ten children with myelodysplastic syndromes diagnosed and followed up over a 3 year period are presented
All of them had anemia and a low platelet count whilst the white blood cell count was variable
Presentation with bilateral proptosis and acute febrile neutrophilic dermatosis (Sweet's syndrome) were unique features observed in one case each
None of these cases could afford specific therapy and thus serve to illustrate the natural history of the disease in pediatric practice
